page.title: 01 WIDCOMBE MANOR
page.content: square 75,63 Widcombe Manor is a privately owned and very beautiful looking building.It has large grounds with a superbly kept garden.The surrounding land is green and fertile containing a few fields.To the rear of the Manor is what looks like a pony paddock.There is a narrow overgrown footpath which follows about two thirds of the perimeter.Running past the Manor grounds is a scenic "B" road. Further along this road there are several cottages and a few large and ornate houses.Opposite one of the larger houses is the church of St.Thomas a Becket.This church was erected in 1498.Just outside the church gates is a war monument dedicated to the soldiers lost in the two world wars.
